Description: Shallow asymmetrical arsenical copper axe-head: with a convex cutting-edge and a concave butt with six drilled binding-holes. The upper end is sharply pointed, the lower broken. The blade is quite thickly corroded. Remnants of linen wrapping survive in the corrosion product. Also preserved is the line of the haft. The cutting edge is eroded and chipped.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (74)
